text: Boltonia apalachicolensis, common name Apalachicola doll's-daisy, is a North American species of plants in the sunflower family. It is found only in the "panhandle" region of northwestern Florida in the United States.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution mapAtlas of Florida Vascular Plants Boltonia apalachicolensis is a plant up to 180 cm (72 inches) tall. It has many daisy-like flower heads with white or lilac ray florets and yellow disc florets.Flora of North America, Apalachicola doll’s-daisy, Boltonia apalachicolensis L.C.AndersonAnderson, Loran Crittendon 1987. Systematic Botany 12(1): 133–138 ==References== Category:Astereae Category:Endemic flora of Florida Category:Plants described in 1987
title: Boltonia apalachicolensis
